definition: to gather/to collect/collected works/classifier for sections of a TV series etc: episode

sentences.english: It’s not straightforward to compare oil spilled on an open sea with garbage picked up on beaches.
sentences.chinese: 要比較外海的油污與在海灘上搜集到的垃圾並非易事。

sentences.english: You cannot make a meal without rice. So gather some information first!
sentences.chinese: 你不能做無米之炊，所以還是先去搜集資料吧。

sentences.english: Collect the new product infmation from current vends .
sentences.chinese: 從現有的供應商中搜集新產品信息。

sentences.english: Gathering log messages in a clustered environment also presents some challenges.
sentences.chinese: 在集羣環境中搜集日誌消息還面臨着一些挑戰。

sentences.english: They taught me to gather objective information, first and foremost.
sentences.chinese: 首先，他們教會我去搜集一些客觀的信息。

sentences.english: About a year ago, I compiled a huge list of artistic sites.
sentences.chinese: 大約一年前，我搜集整理了一個巨大的藝術站點列表。

sentences.english: N 1 In writing the essay he drew heavily on the encyclopedia.
sentences.chinese: 爲寫這篇文章，他從百科全書中搜集了大量材料。

sentences.english: So, right now I’m looking for the best comics ever.
sentences.chinese: 因此，現在我搜集了史上最棒的漫畫作品。

definition: to consult/to refer to/to look sth up in a reference source
summary/to summarize/to collect (data, receipts etc)/to gather and report
to arrange/to tidy up/to sort out/to straighten out/to list systematically/to collate (data, files)/to pack (luggage)
to thumb through/to flip through (a book)
thorough and detailed/exhaustive/the tedious details in full
to screen/to discriminate/to reexamine a case/screening (of applicants etc)
